1. **_A ball is thrown horizontally from the top of a vertical cliff. The cliff is 50 m high and the ball lands 60 m from the bottom of the cliff._**
    a) _How long does it take for the ball to reach the bottom of the cliff?_
    \begin{align*}
    s &= ut + \frac{1}{2}at^2\\
    -50 &= 0 \times t + \frac{1}{2} \times -9.81 \times t^2\\
    \frac{1}{2} \times -9.81t^2 &= -50\\
    \frac{1}{2}\times 9.81t^2 &= 50\\
    9.81t^2 &= 100\\
    t^2 &= 10.19...\\
    t &= 3.19\: s \quad (3s.f.)
    \end{align*}
    b) _What is the horizontal speed of the ball?_
    \begin{align*}
    v &= \frac{s}{t}\\
    &= \frac{60}{3.19...}\\
    &= 18.8\:ms^{-1}\quad(3s.f.)
    \end{align*}
    c) _What is the vertical speed of the ball as it lands?_
    \begin{align*}
    s_v = -50 \quad u_v = 0 \quad v_v &= v_v \quad a_v = -9.81 \quad t = 3.19\\\\
    v^2 - u^2 &= 2as\\
    v^2 &= u^2 + 2as\\
    v &= \sqrt{u^2 + 2as}\\
    &= \sqrt{0^2 + 2\times-9.81\times-50}\\
    &= 31.3 \: ms^{-1} \quad (3s.f.)
    \end{align*}

2. _**A scientist wants to find out how fast he can throw a ball. He throws horizontally from a height of 2 m and it lands 20 m away from where he is standing. Calculate the initial velocity of the ball.**_     
\begin{align*}
s_v = -2 \quad u_v = 0 \quad v_v &= ? \quad a_v = -9.81 \quad t_v = t_v\\
s &= ut + \frac{1}{2}at^2\\
-2 &= 0 \times t \times\frac{1}{2}\times -9.81 \times t^2\\
-2 &= \frac{1}{2} \times -9.81 \times t^2\\
-4 &= -9.81t^2\\
9.81t^2 &= 4\\
t^2 &= \frac{4}{9.81}\\
t &= \sqrt{\frac{4}{9.81}}\\
t &= 0.6385... \: s\\\\
v_h = v_h \quad s_h &= 20 \quad t=0.6835...\\
v &= \frac{s}{t}\\
&= 31.3 \: ms^{-1} \quad(3s.f.)
\end{align*}
3. _**A tennis ball is hit horizontally from the top of a high building. It takes 4 seconds to reach the ground and it lands 80 m from the building.**_
    a) _What is the height of the building?_
    \begin{align*}
    s&= u_vt + \frac{1}{2}at^2 \\
    &= 0 \times 4 + \frac{1}{2}\times -9.81 \times 4^2\\
    &= -78.48 \; m\\
    \text{height}&= 78.48 \; m
    \end{align*}
    b) _At what vertical velocity does the ball hit the ground?_
    \begin{align*}
    v &= u + at\\
    &= 0 + -9.81 \times 4\\
    &= -39.24 \: ms^{-1}
    \end{align*}
    c) _What is the horizontal velocity?_
    \begin{align*}
    v_h &= \frac{s_h}{t}\\
    &= \frac{80}{4}\\
    &= 20 \: ms^{-1}\\
    \end{align*}
    d) _What is its resultant velocity and at what angle does it hit the ground?_
    \begin{align*}
    v_v &= -39.24 \\
    v_h &= 20 \\
    v_R &= \sqrt{(-39.24)^2 + 20^2}\\
    &= 44.04\:ms^{-1}\\
    \end{align*}

    \begin{align*}
    \tan\theta &= \frac{39.24}{20}\\
    &= 1.962\\
    \theta &= 63.0^{\circ}\quad (3s.f.)\\\\
    v_R &= 44.04\:ms^{-1}\text{, }63.0^{\circ} \text{ from the horizontal (ground upon impact).}
    \end{align*}
    
4. _**An object is projected horizontally at a speed of $16 \: ms^{-1}$ into the sea from a cliff top of height 45.0 m. Calculate:**_
    a) _How long it takes to reach the sea._
    \begin{align*}
    s_v = -45 \quad u_v = 0 \quad v_v &= v_v \quad a_v = -9.81 \quad t = t\\
    s_v &= u_vt + \frac{1}{2}a_vt^2\\
    -45 &= 0 \times t + \frac{1}{2}\times -9.81 \times t^2\\
    -45 &= \frac{1}{2}\times -9.81 \times t^2 \\
    -90 &= -9.81t^2\\
    9.81t^2 &= 90 \\
    t^2 &= 9.17...\\
    t&= 3.03 \: s \quad(3s.f.)
    \end{align*}
    b) _How far it travels horizontally._
    \begin{align*}
    v_h &= \frac{s_h}{t}\\
    s_h &= v_h \times t\\
    &= 16 \times 3.03...\\
    &= 48.5 \: m \quad (3s.f.)
    \end{align*}
    c) _Its impact vertical velocity._
    \begin{align*}
     s_v = -45 \quad u_v = 0 \quad v_v &= v_v \quad a_v = -9.81 \quad t = t\\
     v_v^2 - u^2 &= 2as\\
     v_v^2 &= u^2 + 2as\\
     v_v &= \sqrt{u^2 + 2as}\\
     &= \sqrt{0 + 2 \times -9.81 \times -45}\\
     &= 29.7 \: ms^{-1} \quad (3s.f.)
     \end{align*}
